Extract fold change and expression information for power analysis

extract_fc_expression_info.Rd

This function combines fold change effect size sampling with baseline expression data to create a comprehensive dataset for Monte Carlo power analysis simulations. It can handle both user-specified genes and random sampling scenarios.

Usage

extract_fc_expression_info(
  minimum_fold_change,
  gRNA_variability,
  biological_system = "K562",
  B = 200,
  gene_list = NULL,
  TPM_threshold = 10,
  custom_pilot_data = NULL,
  gRNAs_per_target = 4
)

Arguments

minimum_fold_change

Numeric. Minimum expected fold change effect (mean of gRNA effect distribution).

gRNA_variability

Numeric. Standard deviation of gRNA effect sizes, representing variability between gRNAs targeting the same gene.

biological_system

Character. Biological system for baseline expression. Available options: "K562", "A549", "THP-1", "T_CD8", "iPSC" (default: "K562").

B

Integer. Number of Monte Carlo samples to generate when gene_list is NULL (default: 200). Ignored when gene_list is provided.

gene_list

Character vector. Optional list of Ensembl gene IDs to use for analysis. If provided, expression parameters will be extracted for ALL specified genes (no sampling). If NULL (default), B genes are randomly sampled from baseline data.

TPM_threshold

Numeric. Minimum TPM threshold (default: 10). Genes with expression levels below TPM_threshold/1e6 are filtered out before power calculation.

custom_pilot_data

List. Optional custom pilot data. If provided, this data is used instead of the default biological_system data. Must contain baseline_expression_stats (data frame with relative_expression and expression_size columns) and library_parameters (with UMI_per_cell and variation). See reference_data_preprocessing_10x for processing 10x Cell Ranger output and reference_data_processing for further pilot data processing.

gRNAs_per_target

Integer. Number of gRNAs per target (default: 4). Each target will have gRNAs_per_target individual gRNA effect sizes drawn from the specified fold change distribution. avg_fold_change and avg_fold_change_sq are calculated as the mean and mean-of-squares of these gRNA effect sizes.

Value

A list with elements:

fc_expression_df

Data frame with avg_fold_change, avg_fold_change_sq, and expression parameters

minimum_fold_change

Numeric. The input minimum fold change for reference

pilot_data

List. Complete pilot data object for further use

Details

The function operates in two modes:

  • Gene-specific mode (gene_list provided): Uses ALL specified genes, no sampling

  • Random sampling mode (gene_list = NULL): Randomly samples B genes from baseline

In both modes:

  • Sets a random seed for reproducibility

  • Filters genes below TPM threshold (relative_expression < TPM_threshold/1e6)

  • Generates gRNAs_per_target effect sizes per target from a normal distribution

  • Calculates avg_fold_change and avg_fold_change_sq from the gRNA effect sizes

  • Returns combined data for Monte Carlo integration with random effect sizes

See also

get_pilot_data_from_package for direct pilot data access

Examples

# Extract fold change and expression information
fc_expr_data <- extract_fc_expression_info(
  minimum_fold_change = 0.8,
  gRNA_variability = 0.13,
  biological_system = "K562",
  B = 200,
  TPM_threshold = 10,
  gRNAs_per_target = 4
)
#> TPM filtering: Kept 8281 out of 19942 genes (threshold: 10 TPM)
#> Random mode with replacement: Sampled 200 genes from 8281 available genes
